intro: Lastrea duclouxii, commonly known as the Ducloux's lastrea, is a rare and unique species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its blooming period occurs during the cooler months, and it is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, dry conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Lastrea duclouxii is considered a species of conservation concern.
